duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide leadership in the implementation of Board policies and the development of strategies, business plans, budgets, programs, procedures, short- and long-range plans, and administrative and personnel management.
Plan, direct, develop, supervise, coach, train, empower, motivate, and evaluate senior management staff goals, performance, and best practices.
Lead and work with staff on professional development and build a high performance, team-oriented working environment District-wide.
Assist the General Manager with the analysis, preparation, presentation, justification and administration of the District’s budget.
Serve as the District’s State and Federal Grant Administrator.

Work closely and serve as the District representative with other external organizations, including other water districts/agencies, governmental and regulatory agencies, professional and community organizations, citizen boards and commissions, the media, and the general public.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Public Administration, or a related field (Master's preferred)
